website_summaries.verdict: An inexpensive pick for restaurants and health aficionados alike.
pros: Certified for restaurant use, meeting strict health regulations
Works in both right and left hand
cons: Many buyers had issues with the product's durability

website_summaries.verdict: A well-designed alternative to a  standard grater. Easy to use and grates cheese quickly.
pros: Drum detaches, making this easy to clean
The handle can be installed either side for left or right-handed users
Rubber grip features on the handle make it comfortable to use and slip-proof
cons: Some users report the finer grade grater doesn't stand up well to hard cheese

customer_reviews.title: These are good when you don't use them often
customer_reviews.text: These are good when you don't use them often. I bought them for my restaurant and within 2-3 weeks the plastic cracks and becomes unusable. I thought this was just one poorly made one however 3 extras I purchased all ended up in trash due to same reasons. This might be good for someone who rarely ever uses, but definitely has zero durability.
customer_reviews.author: Raiden Ko

customer_reviews.title: Nave no idea where the positive reviews have come from.
customer_reviews.text: This is terrible. The holes in the grating mechanism are so small that cheese just sticks to it instead of falling out, and when it does come out its in big globs. It eventually will get completely clogged and nothing will come out. Do not buy.
customer_reviews.author: DMoore

customer_reviews.title: This grater is worse than useless
customer_reviews.text: I would give this no stars if I could. Impossible to grate hard cheeses such as parmesan. Awkward unwieldy design, and the cheap plastic flexes when pressure is applied. Difficult to disassemble and clean. When I attempted to use this with a softer cheddar, the barrel clogged after a few turns. This grater is worse than useless; it is a waste of one's time. This piece of junk is going straight to the trash bin.
customer_reviews.author: Robyn Ann Shirley

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Full disclaimer: I bought this to grate garlic and ginger, but have also tried it with vegan Parmesan. It works, but as other reviewers mentioned, the fruits of your grinding labors generally end up enmeshed within the shredder and it’s rather laborious trying to dig the goods out with a knife. It is also not easy to clean. This goes for the df cheese, garlic and ginger. It’s easier to just peel and chop everything myself and to use a regular cheese grater for my cheese. Disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: QueenofthehouseTop Contributor: Eye Makeup

customer_reviews.title: this is the one to get
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy anything else... there are graters that look like this one, trust me I know because I bought them. They broke and are cheap. This is the one to buy. We have used it and have no issues. I bought a look alike and it broke after about five ueses. We got a replacement but have avoided using it. Oh by the way, I have seen all the fancy other brands, passed them by
customer_reviews.author: Mark and Julie in Waukesha

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely Wonderful! Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.text: Love this tool. Should have found out about these years ago. Amazing grater. Makes beautiful curls of cheese with almost no effort! Super easy to clean and open and take apart. Highly recommend. Great gift. Paid full price for this grater.
customer_reviews.author: sandyTop Contributor: Bread Making

customer_reviews.title: Pretty damn cool
customer_reviews.text: I love it. My family loves it. We used to use a hand-held flat cheese grater. It took forever to grind enough cheese out of that thing. This little jewel cranks out grated cheese like crazy. We tried all sorts of hard cheeses just to see the thing work, then froze some soft cheeses to see how they worked. Now we mix our cheeses just because it is so easy to do. Asiago/Parmesan rock fish? Simple. Pretty neat. It works. It's cheap. Easy to clean. Handy as hell. Buy one.
customer_reviews.author: Aranhas

customer_reviews.title: Greate Greater
customer_reviews.text: Just like the ZYLISS can opener we've had for years, this is a welcome addition to our kitchen. It does exactly what it is supposed to with ease. It's lightweight, but is not flimsy. Like another reviewer mentioned, we also keep ours in a large Ziploc bag in the fridge with the cheese, so it's ready to go. We only use it for Parmesan, but if we needed to shred another cheese, it disassembles and cleans up with ease.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: How EASY this is to use
customer_reviews.text: I had been grating Parmesan cheese with an old fashioned metal grater, and with really good, hard cheese it took too long and didn't yield enough Parmesan. Wow...this grater is fast and I can grate enough Parmesan cheese to put on my lasagna or my salad, or anything else. I normally do grate about 1/2 a cup at a time and put it in the refrigerator as the grated cheese lasts just fine for a couple of days. Very easy to clean as is comes apart easily and goes back together great. A wonderful idea to make it so that you can use it with your left hand or right hand. Really a good product and seems very well made.
customer_reviews.author: Janice

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, not so easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this to grate parmesan cheese for our Italian family dinners (pasta, lasagna, etc.) I buy bulk parmesan and grate it at the table. The grater works pretty well as long as you have a strong enough hand to hold down the top while you grate. I have not found an easy way to clean it. The leftover cheese gunks up in the teeth when you get it wet and I don't think it comes apart very easily. I would recommend it but just be prepared to spend some time cleaning it.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Marie

customer_reviews.title: This thing rocks! No more grating my thumb!
customer_reviews.text: So I decided to try keto recently and along the way decided to try to stop eating pre-shredded cheese because it usually has corn or potato starch, which adds extra carbs. So I started grating my own cheese with a big cheap grater with a handle, and of course grated the crap out of my thumb. It was then that I decided to buy this. It comes assembled, and once you figure out how to take it apart for cleaning, it's very easy to use and clean. The handle doesn't lift like you would think, but if you twist the open end of the grater barrel the right way, it unscrews from the handle and they both come off.
customer_reviews.author: J. Burke

customer_reviews.title: Completely clogs when grating soft cheese like cheddar and colby
customer_reviews.text: I should have looked at the description closer, as it says its made for hard cheese. Tried with both cheddar and colby, and ended up with a gummed up barrel, as the cheese doesnt fall out, it just clumps together on the inside of the barrel. I typically dont purchase hard cheese, so I'll be returning the item. Wish I had kept the packaging, so you may want to hold onto yours until you've used it a couple of times.
customer_reviews.author: Swoopy

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy. It doesn’t work. Cheap and useless.
customer_reviews.text: I used this to grate cheese. This is the biggest piece of junk I have ever used in my life. I put the cheese in, it got stuck and it grated very little at a time. When the cheese was grated it didn’t come out like normal shredded cheese or grated cheese. It comes out in small, mushy looking bit. I tried a smaller amount of cheese and even with a small amount it’s useless. This belongs at the dollar store if anywhere. Actually, it’s not worth a dollar because it doesn’t work. Looks cheap and when I used it for the first time it kept jamming and did not do the job whatsoever.
customer_reviews.author: Kimber

customer_reviews.title: I do not recommend this to cheese lovers!
customer_reviews.text: I do not recommend this item if you use a lot of cheese as I do... I shredded my own cheese by hand and was hoping to use this item to speed up that process. The internal pieces get clogged and slow your process! I retired mine to the drawer and am back to shredding by hand. The item can not be cleaned throughly by hand; I would have to put it thru 3 cycles in the dishwasher before all the internal part were free of cheese! To hold the cheese grater is very awkward especially after a while when you get a hand cramp!
customer_reviews.author: Bethany Perry

customer_reviews.title: Works well, but cleanup could be easier
customer_reviews.text: The grater works well. Easy to hold, and can get fairly good leverage on the crank handle, though that could be improved. The handle does feel a little flimsy, so I'm concerned about long term durability. Biggest annoyance is dissembling and reassembling the grater for cleaning. The handle needs to be unscrewed from the grating cylinder, and there is nothing to grip onto on the cylinder end opposite the handle. This makes it extremely difficult to get enough force to unscrew the handle. I've seen similar units with knurls or some other protrusions on the output side of the cylinder to assist with grip. This unit needs something like that.
customer_reviews.author: MPH

customer_reviews.title: Use it gently and it will last...
customer_reviews.text: ZYLISS Classic Rotary Cheese Grater - NSF Restaurant Certified These are perfect for hard spaghetti cheeses. Instead of tiny pieces, it produces 1/16" wide strips 1/2" to 3/4" long. To clean it, unscrew the handle, and hand wash or use the dishwasher. The handle mounts on either side. The handle's clockwise threads make this grater best for a right handed person. The only negative is that you need to be gentle when using it, otherwise, it could break.
customer_reviews.author: Victor H. Agresti

customer_reviews.title: Not the cheese grater for me.
customer_reviews.text: I wouldn't buy this if you don't own a dishwasher as cheese was in every nook of this thing. It struggled to shred a block of cheese and the opening for the shredded cheese to come out of got packed in and I had to use a knife to push the packed in cheese out. Due to the cheese clogging in this opening repeatedly, cheese began pushing out of the seams where the hand crank is. Idk if others have had similar issues or if it seems to have just been me.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Reitmann

customer_reviews.title: Works well and built to last.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this grater some time ago and waited to review to see if it would hold up. I can honestly say I use this a few times a week, and so far it has remained sharp as new, and no issues whatsoever. It comes apart easily for cleaning, and is ready to go right back to work. There are a lot of products out there that work well for a month and then say goodbye. This is not one if them. This cheese grater is built to last. I'm very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent C

customer_reviews.title: Hard to clean, hard to use
customer_reviews.text: Just an FYI - If you are going to be using any cheese that tends to be soft, such as cheddar, it quickly gunks up the mechanism of this device and you have to stop and clean it out. And cleaning it out can be quite a pain - even after soaking I've had to use a toothpick to dig old cheese out. I should have ordered one that comes with a variety of grater sizes. This one comes with one that grates the cheese up ultra fine, which may be why it gets so gunked up. I wish I had ordered one with a variety of grater sizes.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia D. Wright

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, will last for long
customer_reviews.text: Take care of it correctly, cleaning after every use and using sensibly and it should last a lifetime. The grater inside is REALLY sharp, so be careful when assembling/disassembling. It supports both left and right handed cranking, and really does make grating cheese easier. If you do not scrape every bit out (I recommend having a small container in the fridge for these leftovers) it will cause you to lose some perfectly good cheese that gets into nooks and crannies after every use. Dishwasher safe, comes out squeaky clean.
customer_reviews.author: Isabela R.

customer_reviews.title: What are you waiting for?
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using box graters and the like for years. It was always a chore to grate a large amount of Parmesan/Romano cheeses for recipes. (My nana had one if these type of rotary cheese graters when I was a child. Don’t know why I waited so long.) I wish I had purchased this years ago. It makes quick work grating these cheeses. As other reviewers mentioned, this should only be used for hard, dry cheeses. It’s totally worth it. Don’t even hesitate. So much tastier to use freshly grated cheese. This makes it a breeze.
customer_reviews.author: Diane Marie

customer_reviews.title: Not easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: Since the handle screws into the grater in the same direction the grater works, it tightens while in use, making it harder for an older person or one with arthritis to take apart for cleaning. also The unit comes with only one grater drum. This is unfortunate for people needing different size or amounts of cheese for cooking. I would not order this unit again.
customer_reviews.author: Curtsinthezone

customer_reviews.title: This is not the grater you're looking for
customer_reviews.text: We had a Zyliss grater for about 10 years and it worked great every single time. Until the handle snapped off. We were so happy with that one, I had to get the same brand. However, brand isn't everything. This new model doesn't deserve the same high praise as the previous version. It is hard to turn. When it does turn, the grated cheese is perfect. But it doesnt' turn so... meh. We went to Williams Sonoma to buy their brand today. Hopefully that will be better.
customer_reviews.author: Addicted to words

customer_reviews.title: Just like the restaurant
customer_reviews.text: Looks like what they use in restaurants Has held up to 2 kids who love Parmesan and don’t care if they break things Feels somewhat flimsy when I use it but we’re going on several months without any problems Kids won’t do the Kraft stuff after they taste real Parmesan I stick it in the dishwasher but think my wife washes it by hand sometimes If it had rubber or more grip on the handles it would help when the block of Parmesan is really big
customer_reviews.author: OL

customer_reviews.title: Cheese gets stuck in grater
customer_reviews.text: Grates the cheese into very fine pieces which all get clogged in the cylinder. After a dozen or more turns with the handle and the cylinder is packed full and we have to bang it on our hand to get the grated cheese out of it. Wife won't use it anymore for that reason. We're grating Cheddar cheese if that makes a difference. Now just another useless piece of kitchen hardware taking up space.
customer_reviews.author: Regular Guy

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: grated my cello Parmesan cheese with this I filled up my old craft container, the cello tastes so much better than the craft I will be grating cello from now on.............this is a good little gadget I would say its for a home owner if you have a restaurant or plan on using it a lot I would get something more heavy duty...it works great for me...8 oz of cheese will last be 3 months so I wont be using it that often
customer_reviews.author: E. Money

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and huge time saver
customer_reviews.text: I grate my own parmesan cheese because I don't like the powdery stuff and the shredded stuff is too hard, right? I was always grating it with a box grater for that in between texture perfect for salads and it was a pain the a**. Hated that chore. I'm not sure why I didn't think of this sooner, but it is a game changer. Takes me only a couple minutes and far less work to grate an entire block of parmesan cheese. I grate it and throw it in the freezer in a zip top bag. Boom, fresh parmesan when you need it! High recommend!
customer_reviews.author: lindsay

customer_reviews.title: great until it broke at 3 years
customer_reviews.text: We bought this in September 2017 as a replacement for a Zyliss grater bought in the early 2000s. That grater was in great shape except the plastic was visibly discolored because of age and the metal grater piece was a little wonky because we'd sent it down the garbage disposal. This grater was really nice until the plastic broke. It is not durable. It lasted three years of moderate (1-2x weekly use) We are really disappointed given our phenomenal experience with our previous Zyliss grater.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Light weight/effective
customer_reviews.text: Good performance. Not a heavy duty item but seems solid enough for light duty. Like that it can adjust for left or right handed people. Dishwasher cleaning is better than hand washing, fyi. Good performance for the cost.
customer_reviews.author: CJ

customer_reviews.title: Warning: this grater is a FAIL against hard cheese.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: - Lightweight and convenient. Cons: - I can't grate my favorite Pecorino Romano from Italy with this. It's too hard for the micro-blades. A total FAIL.
customer_reviews.author: Literary Vagabond

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done with ease.
customer_reviews.text: This baby works great. I’m unsure of the durability as it is plastic and I’ve only used it maybe a dozen times. It gets the job done with hard cheeses like Parmesan and Romano. It’s a pain to clean though. I soak it in really hot water and use a brush to scrub it, but it doesn’t appear to come apart for cleaning; if it does, mine is stuck. I’m worried there’s moldy cheese inside the graying wheel.
customer_reviews.author: Four Horns

customer_reviews.title: Almost a perfect grater- not for we left handed.
customer_reviews.text: A perfect size and would work perfectly were it not for one problem. This is a right handed grater as the wheel is on the right. As I tried to turn it for my left handed purposes, the cheese flew everywhere. It is not doable with a left hand- which is why I gave it a 4. Looks like my husband will be appointed official cheese grater of the house. It's a great little product. The cheese comes out just right. It's small and seems very well made. I do recommend for those of your who are right handed. For us lefties- make friends with a right handed person. Viva la frommage!
customer_reviews.author: Sooner

customer_reviews.title: Want a little cheese on your pasta? Well, of course!
customer_reviews.text: When would have thought you could bring the Olive Garden cheese grater home with you! No we ordered it and love it. We eat pasta often so I actually have kept a piece of the cheese inside it and store it in a half gallon sized bag in the fridge. Just unzip, use it, and put it right away. Truly a hit and great gadget to have!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa F

customer_reviews.title: Definitely recommend this product for tour fresh cheese to be grated onto your food
customer_reviews.text: I like this better than a grater. For fresh cheese, it's an absolute must! Just like the ones they use in the restaurants. You need a strong arm to squeeze down on the hard cheese in it with one hand and turn it with your opposite hand to get the cheese out. But I would absolutely recommend it. I have arthritis and I can do it on most fays that Ive used it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: After wearing out my last grater purchased this one based upon reviews. Love it. well made, gives great grated cheese. One thing I really like is the part that pushes down the cheese. The part is slotted so that if goes all the way to the grater wheel., this way the item being grated is all used.
customer_reviews.author: David M. Sparks

customer_reviews.title: Rugged sensible design
customer_reviews.text: This replaces an older, French, all metal unit that did became corroded and was otherwise flimsy. The French grinder was followed by a plastic rotary grater (similar looking to the Zyliss) which broke after only a dozen or so uses. The Zyliss is a well-designed unit that is easy to clean, and does it's job well.
customer_reviews.author: Mark in Santa Monica

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase!
customer_reviews.text: I have only used this a couple times and I really like it. I only plan to use this to grate parmesan cheese and it's made my life much easier. The item is easy to clean, easy to use, and easy to assemble/disassemble. The grater is easy to turn and the cheese doesn't get stuck or produce a lot of waste once the cheese block starts to wear down.
customer_reviews.author: Zach

customer_reviews.title: Only for hard cheese
customer_reviews.text: I got this grater so it wouldn't be so much work hand grating cheese, but it looks like this is only good for hard cheese like parmesan. Anything softer than that and it will clog up while you're grating, which you will then have to clear out. The opening is not easy to clean out either since soft cheese will stick to it. Would not recommend unless you grate a ton of parmesan.
customer_reviews.author: Julia Yu

customer_reviews.title: GREAT for PARMESAN cheese!
customer_reviews.text: Love it!!! Been wanting one of these for a long time - don't know why I waited so long! Bought it to use for parmesan reggiano cheese so I don't grate my fingers/knuckles off. (Only had it for a short time so we'll see about durability that others seem to complain about.) Not sure what kind of cheese others are using it for that it gets clogged up or breaks....... Also easy to take apart and clean. Doesn't take a rocket scientist to figure out how to take it apart.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just threw it away
customer_reviews.text: I hate this thing. I tried for months to like it but no, just no. It doesn’t do a great job and the cheese gets stuck inside. Hard to clean. The handle loves to fall off. I threw it in the trash this morning.
customer_reviews.author: lt90

customer_reviews.title: Weak lever
customer_reviews.text: This is replacing an older Zyliss I had that finally cracked. The blades are very good but, unlike my older one, this one only comes with one smaller size of grating instead of two. My real concern with this one, though, is that the plastic is flimsier so the press-down lever is less firm, meaning you have to compress it even harder, and I can imagine it getting looser over time. My older version could also require hard compression but the plastic was stronger.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Grated cheese gets stuck inside
customer_reviews.text: I was excited about this grater because it said it's restaurant certified and reviews said it can be used with either hand. I'm a lefty. The problem is that the grated cheese doesn't fall out of the grater into a bowl. It all gets stuck inside the grater piece. I had to use a knife to get it out. In my opinion, it's not worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Tracie Adams

customer_reviews.title: Great rotary grater for hard cheeses
customer_reviews.text: After trying multiple cheeses we have realized what it is made for, and does the best job grating is hard cheeses. We tried an aged cheddar that ended up getting clogged in both the blade compartment and within the handheld part, which was then very difficult to get clean.
customer_reviews.author: Erin Marie

customer_reviews.title: Friend of the Foodie
customer_reviews.text: I love to cook stuff and fresh shredded hard cheeses like Parmesan adds a lot of real flavor. This shredder comes apart easily to clean and shreds a fine shred. Not a course shred. I formerly used one of the flat metal shredders, those are bush league. Use a grown up shredder. Would buy again and recommend to friends.
customer_reviews.author: Bobcat

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic for firm cheeses
customer_reviews.text: My Wife & I use this each time we make any dish that goes well with some parmesan cheese. It's nearly identical to the one you see at many restaurants, comes apart easy, fits in the dishwasher. If you need to grate soft or high-moisture cheeses, use something else.
customer_reviews.author: Ari Berry

customer_reviews.title: Hard to Clean
customer_reviews.text: Great product, you can use it right or left handed, but it is hard to clean the inside of the blade. Although it all comes apart for cleaning, only one end come off of the blade is open. Knowing it is normally utilized for mozzarella cheese and when it melts with hot water it stuck in the plastic groves as the bottom of the closed side of the round blade, making it hard to reach and clean. Helpful hint: rinse with hot water holding the closed plastic side upright.
customer_reviews.author: Mooszka

customer_reviews.title: Good for hard cheese (and ONLY hard cheese), but very difficult to disassemble for cleaning
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Works extremely well for grating hard cheese, such as Parmesan. The grated cheese is finely grated and has a nice fluffy texture. Comes apart (with difficulty) allowing for thorough cleaning (but see my comment in the “cons” section below). Cons: Because it’s a fine grater, it does not work for soft cheese. If you want to grate anything other than Parmesan (or similar), get something with coarser holes. Yes, it comes apart for cleaning, but it’s next to impossible to get a grip on the slippery plastic in order to unscrew it. I literally have to use Vise-Grip pliers to grab hold of the end of the grating barrel.
customer_reviews.author: Alaskan Steve

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous grater!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used this grater three times in the few days I’ve had it. I grated Romano, Mizithra and Parmesan cheeses. It grates and the handle turns easily to create fine shavings. To clean the handle unscrews and the stainless grater slides out the side hole. It washes up very easily with a soft brush. I’m thoroughly delighted with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Too much maintenance
customer_reviews.text: Eah. Looks like it should work well but nah. It might be okay for hard cheese, however anything soft gets stuck almost immediately. It's very difficult to take apart and even apart is still hard to clean. I find I have to take it apart a few times just to finish a block of cheese.
customer_reviews.author: jsky

customer_reviews.title: Grates Hard Cheeses Well
customer_reviews.text: I've been through several cheese graters in the past 5 years. This grater handles all cheeses and is really able to get through aged Parmesan. We eat pasta regularly and nothing is better than a hard Italian cheese right before it's served. Finally, a grater than can handle any cheese.
customer_reviews.author: G. Robinson

customer_reviews.title: An Italian Restaurant uses these
customer_reviews.text: I don't like pre-grated parmesan cheese. I found these that closely resemble what the use at a restaurant we go to, and now I can easily grate a block of parmesan cheese to my heart's content. Easy to turn and to clean for my arthritic hands.
customer_reviews.author: Pups 'n Kits

customer_reviews.title: Works well for hard cheeses.
customer_reviews.text: This works well for hard cheeses like Parmesan. I have grated approximately 20bls of cheese since purchasing this, and it has paid for itself with time saved. When/if it breaks I will buy another. Cleaning is not the easiest, as there is not much to get a good grip to dissemble. I would like to see them put a notch to help with dissembly.
customer_reviews.author: cbkraft

customer_reviews.title: Great little grater!
customer_reviews.text: Really like this grater - much easier to use than box or paddle graters. My favorite feature is that you can attach the handle on either side - flexibility I so appreciate as a lefty. The only downfalls I’d say are that you have to use a good amount of force to hold the cheese in place as you grate, and it’s better for hard cheeses - soft cheeses tend to get stuck in the wheel. Those are not a huge deal though - I would definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: SB

customer_reviews.title: Perfect kitchen gadget
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't sure if i would like this kitchen gadget but I was tired of using a hand held grater and grating my fingers or knuckles, so I thought I would give it a try and I'm so HAPPY I did,, it works great, cleans great in fact I liked it so much I bought a second one for our summer place.
customer_reviews.author: scubagirl

customer_reviews.title: Worse cheese grater I have ever used!
customer_reviews.text: I got so mad, I threw this junk in the trash after first use. First problem is that the grater holes inside the grater are tiny, very small. This caused the cheese to become like a paste and clog the inner chamber. I had to get a knife and dig the cheese out which took like 10 minutes. I would NOT recommend this product. Spend your money on something that actually works.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole S.

customer_reviews.title: YOU WILL LOVE THIS!
customer_reviews.text: OMG, I just absolutely love this cheese grater. It is very easy to take apart to clean & put back together. This gem works so well, just like the restaurants use. With the cheese in it still so easy to turn the crank handle. So on a scale of 1-5 1= sucks & 5 = awesome I would give it a 6 stars ****** !
customer_reviews.author: Stephen M.

customer_reviews.title: Only grind very hard cheese or get a better one.
customer_reviews.text: First time trying this product and I'm really dissatisfied, was grinding sharp cheddar cheese which was not very soft cheese, it got stuck inside the drum and I could not even unscrew the handle to try and get the cheese out. They should inform you that it's only good for very hard cheese. I ended up having to lose cheese with this grater because I had to run water through it in order to get the cheese out. Not happy at all and maybe returning the product.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie S.

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: Cheese will clump inside cylinder and very hard to get out. Maybe if it was a course grater it wouldn’t have this problem. Disappointed in purchase; already ordered a different style
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Great, just clogs a bit sometimes
customer_reviews.text: It really does work well, only complaint is that we've had it clog a time or two. Not a terrible inconvenience, but it does slow things down from time to time. Disassembly to clean is great, and overall we are pretty happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: BumbleBee

customer_reviews.title: DIdn't keep it long enough to know about durability or ease of cleaning
customer_reviews.text: Only one grater and it's for fine shredding - no medium or course option. The shreds balled up inside. Pour ergonomics for trying to get the chunk of cheddar through the grater. Even my husband, who has a very strong grip, thought it was miserable. Will go back to look for another one, more like my previous grater which lasted for six years and about which I never had a complaint. I didn't save the packaging for return so this landed in the trash after first use.
customer_reviews.author: nonnie

customer_reviews.title: ...just like the restaurants when they bring the cheese
customer_reviews.text: I love love this gadget...it is sturdy, easy to hold, very easy to use, and you do not have to handle the cheese, only when you are cutting your piece for this shredder. Price was good too. I am ordering another two for my two sons who also are cooks. Thanks for a cool gadget that really works!!
customer_reviews.author: Adelina M. Alvarez

customer_reviews.title: Incredible 1 time use grater
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely useless. Returning this after one use. A nightmare to disassemble and the grater has a nook for some reason that caught all my leftover cheese. I will be purchasing another rotary grater and I recommend you do too
customer_reviews.author: Bruno

customer_reviews.title: Great parm grater, just wish it was metal.
customer_reviews.text: As expected, it's: easy to use and does a great job with fine grating of cheese. I just wish it was metal (the plastic seems sturdy enough) and it'd be nice if it was easier to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Fossum

customer_reviews.title: Just like the one at the Olive Garden
customer_reviews.text: I saw this when I went to Olive Garden so I went to amazon to find it. Works very nicely with hard cheeze. I keep it in a ziplock bag with the cheeze inside so it’s always ready
customer_reviews.author: just me

customer_reviews.title: Just what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: This is sturdy, attractive, and works really well. Adding freshly grated cheese to everything makes it better, and it looks awesome at the table when you grate fresh cheese on your guests' platters.
customer_reviews.author: Eliza

customer_reviews.title: Nice Grater
customer_reviews.text: This grater is better than the last 2 I had but the handle could be sturdier. It could be because I am struggling with a little arthritis in my hand ,but you do need to but pressure on it. Good value. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Vrabel

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use quality product
customer_reviews.text: These are super! I have been using them for years at the Italian Restaurant that I used to work at. It's just great quality product, rinse and throw it in the dishwasher for clean up or spray it off.
customer_reviews.author: Allison Richards

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn't buy again
customer_reviews.text: This leaves a bit to be desired. Grating anything softer than parmesan is a waste of time; the cheese squeezes in between the blade portion and the rest of the unit and doesn't grate, plus the cheese that does end up grated just gets stuck. Even parmesan will squeeze between the blade and the rest of the unit too. It's also somewhat difficult to turn.
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: Easy
customer_reviews.text: It works for the left and right handed. I'm right handed and my sons and husband are solid left handers. I appreciate the ease of use and clean up. I have used it to grate small amounts of vegetables. There's a 5 year warranty with it.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra A.

customer_reviews.title: Not the quality expected from Zyliss
customer_reviews.text: Zyliss is no longer Swiss the product design and quality have greatly suffered. I had the older Swiss made and designed version of this grinder and it was better in every way. The materials used are sub par, the blades are cheaply made and not well designed to make good shavings of cheese. The body of the grinder has odd grooves and pockets in it that fill with cheese and are difficult to clean and waste cheese.
customer_reviews.author: Lewis Browne

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: We love this cheese grater and wondered what took us so long to get it. No more parmesan cheese from a bottle. The Olive Garden gave us the idea that we should have one. We haven't washed ours we keep it in the refrigerator in a ziploc bag with a block of cheese and we just tap out the old cheese and add a slice to the grater part.
customer_reviews.author: Allura-Ella

customer_reviews.title: Threw it away the first day
customer_reviews.text: I don't know if I got a defective one but the shredder tube had tiny holes that didn't cut through any cheese, hard or soft. There was just no place for it to go. Clogged up immediately and was impossible to clean.
customer_reviews.author: oregps

customer_reviews.title: It’s cheap and it works just fine!
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t have a cheese grater, so before I go buy a really expensive one, I bought this one, let’s see if we really use it. It’s cheap and works just fine! We don’t eat a lot of foods that requires grated cheese. I clean it best I can and then put it in the dishwasher. And make sure all the food remnants are out. I think this was money well spent.
customer_reviews.author: HaHa

customer_reviews.title: It was good while it lasted.
customer_reviews.text: I primarily used this item for shredding hard cheeses, like Parmesan and Asiago. It worked just fine for about two months but then some cheese got stuck in the cylinder and I wasn’t able to turn the handle or disassemble it in an attempt to remove the cheese. Instead, I invested in an electric shredder and it has made my life MUCH easier!
customer_reviews.author: ADD

customer_reviews.title: Mediocre
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately it gets stuck and it’s hard to get actual shredded cheese. Pain to clean when it gets gunked up. Not high quality but for the price it is what it is.
customer_reviews.author: Zach Smith

customer_reviews.title: MUCH better than Oxo
customer_reviews.text: This grater works MUCH better than the Oxo we've used for a good while. Granted, it doesn't have a cap to "seal" it, but it does grate Parmesan BEAUTIFULLY! I just put mine in a Zip-Loc, 'til I need some more.
customer_reviews.author: John Chester

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic great product i just love using it i feel so fancy like I'm a professional chef. I use it to grate fresh Parmesan cheese. So much better than the old dried up stuff in the jar they sell at the grocery store with the million other ingredients and preservatives in. Fresh is the way to go!!! You will love it!!!
customer_reviews.author: SHELLEY

customer_reviews.title: Better Grinder than the similar OXO.
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use grating hard cheeses. I have cleaned it in the dishwasher. Also useful to grind soft nuts like Pignoli Pine Nuts and Cashews
customer_reviews.author: Sometimes unhappy

customer_reviews.title: Holes are too small
customer_reviews.text: The holes are too small and when I try to grate cheddar or Colby jack cheese most of it gets caught inside the wheel. It works well for drier cheeses like Parmesan. I’m getting the other grater with different sizes for my other cheeses.
customer_reviews.author: Adelena

customer_reviews.title: love this!
customer_reviews.text: I am so happy I got this. It's one of those things you don't think you need, but then you wonder how you grated cheese without it. It's easy to use, no mess. It produces A LOT of grated cheese from just a small piece of parmesan cheese.
customer_reviews.author: Mom in NJ

customer_reviews.title: The greater grater!
customer_reviews.text: It grates cheese, hard cheese. Not for soft cheeses. This is a man's type of grater. Hard cheese and plenty of it! Excellent product, easy to clean, right or left handed. Why are you still reading this? Order it now!
customer_reviews.author: Rick from Maine

customer_reviews.title: Just like olive garden
customer_reviews.text: I got this because my hand goes numb when I use it so grating cheese on a normal grater became dangerous. This is SO SOOO easy. I love this!
customer_reviews.author: Mitchy Mitchy Moo

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This little gadget is a kitchen must have. If you eat shredded cheese you have to have this. We have been using this non-stop for meals. Very easy to use and clean.
customer_reviews.author: Michele Barker

customer_reviews.title: Small but effective
customer_reviews.text: The grinder is smaller than the Pamper Chef grinder it replaced. It grinds well but does not hold large pieces of cheese. First use on hard Parmesan and the handle is now stuck in the body; can't disassemble to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: My husband bought this to grate cheese and I swear now he feels/acts like he works at Olive Garden! Thought he was crazy for purchasing at first but I can’t even lie it was a great buy! Assembles and disassembles easily.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha B

customer_reviews.title: Okay!
customer_reviews.text: Good value for the cost but, like most of these, not extremely solid or durable. Very light weight and not something I expect will ensure daily use for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: SoBayCPA

customer_reviews.title: Good, but not perfect
customer_reviews.text: This tool results in a coarser grate than my old Zyliss, but that means it grates cheese more quickly. The apparently unnecessary "teeth" at the end of the upper arm press result in cheese residue remaining in the inner surface of the grater, and for this reason I give this product a 4 instead of a 5. Otherwise, it works well.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn D. Wylie

customer_reviews.title: Cranky Crank, Sharp Cutter, Hard to Use
customer_reviews.text: I find this grater awkward to use. I have arthritis and turning the crank while holding the cheese feeder in place is no fun. Hard to cut parmesan cheese to fit in the feeder. Better watch out cleaning the cutting blade as it is sharp and prickly. Wish I had bought a simpler device.
customer_reviews.author: Major T

customer_reviews.title: Just what I wanted!
customer_reviews.text: So happy to have ordered this. It is just what I wanted. My old rotary cheese grater was hard to hold and impossible to clean because it didn't come apart. I am so glad to have this one! "Just tell me when...." there is never enough grated Parmesan!
customer_reviews.author: Barb Childers

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Grater!  Get One!
customer_reviews.text: Super pleased with this purchase. Wish I had purchased sooner. Makes grating cheeses so easy. Simple to use and to disassemble for cleaning. Can assemble with handle to right or left for ease of operation. Has worked well for me with parmesan, gruyere, asiago, and fontina. Would buy again. Would make a great gift.
customer_reviews.author: CJBS

customer_reviews.title: Too hard to clean
customer_reviews.text: This grater works fine, but how are you supposed to clean the damn thing? If it came apart, it would be much easier to clean. Otherwise you have to keep spinning the part inside, trying to scrub off bits of cheese on the part that is visible, and constantly turning it to reveal more cheese pieces :(
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Levison

customer_reviews.title: Durable and works great
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, durable. I think any grater or mesh strainer are a pain to clean but other than that it's great!
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: kind of works
customer_reviews.text: used with some sharp cheddar, gummed up the greater drum in the middle and was unable to grate much cheese.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Lunchaousen

customer_reviews.title: Quick & easy
customer_reviews.text: Love this rotary grater! Makes shredding cheese much quicker and less risk of shredding my fingers. Easy to take apart to clean, but kind of a pain to get clean.
customer_reviews.author: Cassie

customer_reviews.title: This product is a steaming pile of $#1t!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product believing it would be at least as functional as a normal shredder with some added utility, and I was dead wrong; not only could this pos not shred cheese, it got stuck in the cylinder (which jammed and could not be removed) so I had to remove the cheese by hand, and was unable to shred any more cheese. I threw it in the trash, I would recommend you avoid this product.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: The perfect rotary cheese grater
customer_reviews.text: Originally had the OXO Good Grips Seal and Store Rotary Cheese Grater. Biggest regret ever. I checked out the reviews for this. This was made totally different. The flaws of the OXO are not in this design. This works and looks just like the Olive Garden variety and I was able to imitate them during dinner tonight for my wife. 'Tell me when to stop.......' (grate, grate, grate).
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: I wish the blade was removable to make it easier to clean but other than that great product. Took a few tries to realize I didnt need to squeeze so hard on the handle and it is much easier if you let the blades do the work
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: This one is my second Zyliss. I wore the first one out (broke the handle off) and Prime had me a new one in a couple of days. This model is slightly different than my old one but that's not surprising after so many years. Works as well (at least) as the old one. Lots of cheese ground.
customer_reviews.author: sometimes traveler

customer_reviews.title: Ease of use
customer_reviews.text: Love it. So easy to use. Throw a piece of cheese in it. Turn the handle. Voila!! Grated cheese. Easy disassembly for cleaning.
customer_reviews.author: Grammie

customer_reviews.title: so easy
customer_reviews.text: We couldn't believe we went this long without this grater, we use Parmesan so much and this makes grating so much easier.
customer_reviews.author: GK

product_meta.title: Zyliss Classic Rotary Cheese Grater-NSF Restaurant Certified, White
product_meta.description: Size:NSF CertifiedThe Zyliss Classic Cheese Grater is designed to grate more cheese in less time, while being more comfortable to use. Used table-side in restaurants and households alike. Comes with fine drum for grating hard cheeses, chocolate, nuts and more. Grating drum is now easier to remove for cleaning. NSF Restaurant Certified.
feature_bullets: NSF Restaurant Certified rotary cheese grater meeting strict standards for public health protection
Fine drum for grating hard cheeses, chocolate, nuts and more
Drum and handle separate for easy cleaning
Handle switches sides for left or right handed use

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars2,593 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
